org.actus.attributes

Class ContractModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.actus.attributes.ContractModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ContractModelProvider

    public class ContractModel
extends Object
implements ContractModelProvider
    A data structure representing the set of ACTUS contract attributes

    This is a simple implementation of the ContractModelProvider interface representing a generic data structure for the various ACTUS attributes parametrizing a ContractType. Method parse allows parsing the attributes from an input String representation to the internal data types.

    Note, an ACTUS ContractType can deal with any data structure implementing the ContractModelProvider interface. Thus, depending on the system ACTUS is embedded in, more efficient data structures and parsing methods are possible.

    See Also:
    ACTUS Data Dictionary

      • ContractModel

        public ContractModel(Map<String,Object> attributes)
        Constructor

        The map provided as the constructor argument is expected to contain pairs of attributes using ACTUS attribute names (in long form) and data types of values as per official ACTUS data dictionary.

    • Method Detail

      • of

        public static ContractModel of(Map<String,Object> attributes)
        Create a new contract model from a java map

        The map provided as the method argument is expected to contain pairs of attributes using ACTUS attribute names (in long form) and data types of values as per official ACTUS data dictionary.

        Parameters:
        attribute - a java map of attributes as per ACTUS data dictionary
        Returns:
        an instance of ContractModel containing the attributes provided with the method argument

      • parse

        public static ContractModel parse(Map<String,String> attributes)
        Parse the attributes from external String-representation to internal, attribute-specific data types

        For the ContratType indicated in attribute "ContractType" the method goes through the list of supported attributes and tries to parse these to their respective data type as indicated in the ACTUS data dictionary ().

        For all attributes mandatory to a certain "ContractType" the method expects a not-null return value of method get of the Map<String,String> method parameter. For non-mandatory attributes, a null return value is allowed and treated as that the attribute is not specified. Some attributes may be mandatory conditional to the value of other attributes. Be referred to the ACTUS data dictionary for details.

        Parameters:
        attributes - an external, raw (String) data representation of the set of attributes
        Returns:
        an instance of ContractModel containing the attributes provided with the method argument
        Throws:
        AttributeConversionException - if an attribute cannot be parsed to its data type

      • getAs

        public <T> T getAs(String name)
        Description copied from interface: ContractModelProvider
        Access a Contract Attribute in its data type

        The various attributes collected in a ContractModelProvider are used as parameters when evaluating an ACTUS ContractType. This method allows accessing the various attribute values. In order to make sure that attributes are returned in the correct target data type (according to the ACTUS data dictionary) the respective class name should be provided when calling the method, e.g. model.<String>getAs("ContractRole"), model.<Double>getAs("NotionalPrincipal"). If not provided explicitly, the target data type is inferred from the context (if possible).

        Specified by:
        getAs in interface ContractModelProvider
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the attribute to retrieve
        Returns:
        a type-casted object-reference to the attribute requested.
